How North Korea infiltrates its IT experts into Western companies
subhead: Developers working under false identities aim to funnel their salaries back to the North Korean state or blackmail their employers. Major companies have been affected, primarily in the United States but, more recently, also in France.

Trump tells Russia to resolve its Ukraine war in 50 days
Sudden cardiac arrests in athletes reveal hidden micro-abnormalities in the heart
subhead: A French study found that in 14 out of 19 people who survived sudden cardiac arrest during exercise, advanced heart scans revealed tiny electrical abnormalities despite normal results on standard medical tests.

headline: Chinese police crack down on young women writing homoerotic fiction
subhead: Police in China have arrested young women writers over novels featuring homosexual relationships between androgynous young men. While Chinese law bans erotic content, the authorities are particularly concerned about what they see as a challenge to traditional family values.

headline: In Angers, you can find world-class fries
subhead: Winning the world championship for 'authentic fries' allowed Alexandre and William Laigo, two Angers natives aged 30 and 28, to open a new, larger restaurant. The two brothers are now dreaming of launching their own franchise.

headline: In photos: Paris's Bastille Day fireworks and pyrotecnics show
subhead: Alongside the traditional fireworks, more than 1,000 drones swirled above the Eiffel Tower on Monday night, illuminating the Parisian sky to conclude a weekend of festivities.

China, the energy transition superpower
subhead: Solar panels, wind power and batteries: In just 15 years, China has risen to the top of the global clean energy industry, leaving European countries trailing far behind.

headline: The dazzling legacy of iconoclastic jewelry designer Attilio Codognato
subhead: Known for his snake- and skull-shaped jewelry, the iconoclastic designer who died in 2023 also left behind an astonishing collection of works by Andy Warhol, Marcel Duchamp and Maurizio Cattelan, now fiercely protected by his children. His Venetian boutique, once a magnet for global celebrities, remains the only place in the world to find Codognato's singular creations.

headline: In China, Beijing cyclists take to the streets at night
subhead: As night falls, a large group of Chinese workers and students set off by bicycle down the capital's main avenue. Their goal: to relieve the day's stress and briefly claim one of the symbols of political power.
